Name: Cognitive Electrophysiology in Socioeconomic Context in Adulthood
Acknowledgements: We thank Isbell Development, Experiences, and Achievement (IDEA) lab research assistants for their contributions to data collection, and the adults who participated in the study.
Funding: research start-up funds awarded to Elif Isbell by University of California Merced.
EthicsApprovals: This study was approved by the University of California Instituional Review Board.
ReferencesAndLinks: Isbell, E., De León, N. E. R., & Richardson, D. M. (2024). Childhood family socioeconomic status is linked to adult brain electrophysiology. PloS One, 19(8), e0307406.
Kappenman, E. S., Farrens, J. L., Zhang, W., Stewart, A. X., & Luck, S. J. (2021). ERP CORE: An open resource for human event-related potential research. NeuroImage, 225, 117465.
